Expectation1: Secure packages and confirm successful delivery
Situation1: Hand-delivering a high-value or sensitive package directly to the recipient and verifying their identity
Situation2: They strictly follow a detailed schedule of daily prayers, chanting, and offerings, ensuring nothing is skipped.
Story: I glanced at my watch as I parked my scooter in front of the apartment building. The package on my seat was marked “High Value—Recipient Only.” My company expected me to hand it directly to the customer and check their ID, no exceptions. I grabbed the parcel, feeling the weight of responsibility, but my mind was elsewhere. It was almost time for my midday puja, the daily prayer I never missed. My mother always said, “No matter where you are, honor your dharma.” I could already hear the temple bells in my mind, the scent of incense calling me home. But the recipient wasn’t answering their phone, and the building’s security guard wouldn’t let me leave the package. I felt the pressure mounting—my job demanded patience and thoroughness, but my faith demanded punctuality and devotion. My hands trembled as I weighed the package, the minutes ticking by, torn between my duty as a delivery person and my commitment as a Hindu.
